Reviews.Title: “3 strikes..... We're out!”
Reviews.Author: hixona
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations months ago. We arrived after the 3:00pm check-in and were offered a smoking room. I have never booked a smoking room in my life! We were given the option to smell the room and it was horrible. We were offered a second room that was non-smoking, but smaller for our family. We were going to settle on the second room and were then offered the original room we reserved. We had our luggage on the cart and opened the door. Imagine our shock when we saw someone else's stuff already in the room. Very scary! Luckily the guest was not in sight. We went back to the lobby and Jun called the owner for the third time. After an hour, we left the hotel and had to cut our vacation short. We have cancelled our "priority club" membership and will probably not stay at a Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Short but fun trip to Universal Studios Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: hulkstillrules
Reviews.Content: This was a Spring Break Trip for me, wife and kiddos age 8 and 5. We stayed Sun-Wed in mid March. The main purpose was a quick trip to visit USH. All of us really love it there and is much cheaper than Legoland or Disney. The hotel is very quaint. It is tucked up under the hillside in Hollywood. The cool thing that I thought about it is that there is one way in and one way out. There is a very small parking garage (free of charge) that you would think would fill up quickly, but we never had any problems finding a parking spot. The rooms are normal HIE rooms and the real selling point is the breakfast in the morning. It was a real value for the money and served the exact purpose of our trip. I would stay there again on another trip to USH. A couple of negatives though. If you get a room on the freeway side and are a light sleeper, be prepared to wake up alot. However, I just turned on the A/C unit fan and the white noise from that, mostly cancelled the traffic noise. Also, I read somewhere that the hotel has a shuttle to and from USH. That is not true. There may be a shuttle, but it isn't contracted through the hotel, or a hotel van. USH is always a great theme park for us. My kids really love the Simpsons ride and the Jurassic Park ride. We did these numerous times. From the Studio tour to the Blues Brothers we had a very fun vacation. Thanks for reading. I hope this review helps. Happy Trails.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, Ideal for Universal”
Reviews.Author: scotsman2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel number 2 on our West Coast trip! Another great Holiday Inn Express in my opinion. Very warmly welcomed by Jun on the front desk, very polite, welcomed as a priority member, & upgraded to a Junior suite, he even called our room after 10 minutes to make sure everything was fine for us, really appreciated. The room was great, spotlessly clean & spacious, comfortable beds. We were on the 2nd floor facing the main road but noise was minimal. Breakfast was really good, same choice as in other expresses and no complaints from me there! Got your day off to a good start. Jun on the front desk was great, you can ask him anything and he will help you out. I asked him where the best place was to get a photo with the Hollywood sign and he gave us an address for the satnav, got some great photos close to the sign, would never have found that location otherwise, its a bit of a drive up narrow winding roads but totally worth it!! Universal is roughly a 10 minute walk, basically turn left out of the hotel, walk down to Universal Studios Boulevard, turn right & walk up the hill to Universal & Citywalk. All in all, a great value hotel which was Ideally located for us. (A pat on the back for Jun on the front desk please if management read this!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on spring break. My wife and our two children. We got a family suite. The rooms were clean and big. They also had a very nice breakfast the next morning. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I would certainly stay here again! The location was convenient to the attractions we were going to.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised”
Reviews.Author: Vinny102
Reviews.Content: We read some reviews before booking so we knew what to expect but all in all for the price it wasn't bad. The restaurant at the hotel was pretty good there was a shuttle to and from universal studios which took us maybe 10 min to get there. The hotel was close to a grocery store and a rite aid so if you needed to get so something it was within walking distance. The room was a little better than what I expected but nothing special it was clean soft bed no complaints. The only thing which I had read was that there was no solid curtain to block out the green light and you do get some noise from the road. Bottom line if you are looking for something cheaper than the hilton and the Sheraton I would say it is worth a shot. Unless I found a deal at the Hilton or Sheraton I would definitely stay here again. The shuttle for me was a big factor even though a cab couldn't have been that much but just the fact that they had a free shuttle running a convient schedule was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about internet access”
Reviews.Author: BicoastalBunny
Reviews.Content: The rooms are much nicer than the Holiday Inn Express Hollywood Walk of Fame, which is just down the street. I had to log into the internet, using the hotel's access info every 3 minutes...literally...so I finally gave up. I had asked the front desk about the internet problems twice and both times, they said they would check on it and call me back...which never happened. The front desk staff were cold. But if I am in need of a hotel in the area, I would choose this one over the walk of fame HI.

Reviews.Title: “On a Budget?”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruiseCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is the place to be. We were very pleased with our stay at Holiday Inn Express. All the Staff we came in contact with, were all pleasant and helpful. The Hotel location was right off the freeway ramp. The location to Universal Studios & Universal City Walk was great. We had a room reserved for three nights and we found the room to be very roomy and clean. In the morning, a 'Breakfast Bar' was served in the lobby of the hotel. We were expecting the usual, coffee, juice, sweet rolls, apples, bananas, cereals, etc. What a surprise to see, on a different morning of our stay, scrambled eggs, cheese omelets, biscuits w/gravy, bacon, sausages, toast were also being served. They also had a neat pancake machine that made fresh pancakes right on the spot. I forgot to mention, this Yummy Breakfast, was included in the price of our hotel room.....And yes, I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “For the budget conscious traveling solo in LA”
Reviews.Author: Behrcat
Reviews.Content: First time staying in Los Angeles I wanted to be near the attractions in the area: Universal Studios, Universal Citywalk, and Warner Brothers Studios. I also wanted to feel safe walking around at night as I was traveling alone (yes, female). This hotel delivered on location. I got what I need a solo traveler, did not have to worry about finding a place for breakfast (they provide an adequate one even for someone like me who has dietary restrictions) and the rooms were clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Jun at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: hilario b
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is on the side of freeway but when you get inside the room, it was quiet enough to have a good night sleep. The room is very very clean. It is adjacent to Universal Studio, 2 miles from Hollywood walk of fame.....Call them to have a best deal...

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: DiBecker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights to visit Hollywood and Universal. Its a fairly short walk to Universal and the local bus stops right outside to take you into Hollywood. Its close to a freeway so you can hear the traffic. The breakfast was good, real boiling water for tea - amazing and I loved the pancake machine. They stored our bags after check out so we could go to Universal. The 2 restaurants we visited nearby were great - a French and an Italian, even though it seems like in the middle of nowhere. My only advice is if you are getting an airport shuttle here - print out a google map. Our worst experience of our 3 week US holiday was getting to this place. The driver got lost 3 times, abused the hell out of us for not knowing where it was and then charged us double what he quoted because it took over an hour to find. Maybe he was just a dope - but take a map in case.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Good Breakfast - Free Parking - Walking Distance to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Shey07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you are visting LA. There is free parking, so if you are visiting Universal Studios you can avoid having to drive and pay for parking as you can walk to universal studios from the hotel. It is also well situated to other attractions. The rooms are clean, the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: LoMohr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 10 min walk to Universal Studios, there's a Starbucks, gas station and restaurants across the street, and the staff were so nice! Very convenient and great value.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Theives in rooms and bars on the windows!”
Reviews.Author: BrawnyGirl
Reviews.Content: Our laptop was stolen from his hotel and not one accomodation has been made to help replace it or make ammends for what obviously was a staff theft. The room was locked. Only hotel staff had access during our stay. They are claiming that nothing can/will be done. 3 times we have been promised a return call regarding this matter , each time over 48 hours has gone by with no contact. The laptop was purchased by my 10 year old who worked for 2.5 years to earn the $. Now... it's just gone and there is no compassion or resolution from the hotel. "Call your attorney" is the response we get from Customer Relations. Not to mention...There are bars on the windows of the rooms... not sure how one would escape if needed. We are priority members and have been treated terribly. As a consumer, I am very disappinted. The least this hotel could do would be to refund the $188 hotel room to help pay for a replacement of this computer. VERY SAD! Beware! ** A quick search shows that we are not the first to have items stolen from rooms at ths hotel. Seems like a big problem!**

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced hotel Very Close to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Glee9
Reviews.Content: So many hotels to choose from in LA, and we decided to stay near Universal Studios. The hotel was not cheap (around 110 pounds per night) but breakfast is included! The rooms are clean, but no views. The car park is difficult to find, as the only (large) sign can only be seen from Barham turnoff from the expressway. Breakfast is functional with hot cinnamon buns, rubberised Mac-type pancakes and muffins galore. Lots of fruit available to take away! A little circumspect about walkability to Universal Studios, but we did it and it took 10 minutes, 2 blocks and cross the expressway (by bridge) Saves on the 7 dollars carpark fee! Would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Symm
Reviews.Content: I was staying for a conference in LA and choose this hotel based on proximity and price. The check-in experience was quick and painless. I stayed in a junior suite. The room was large, equipped with a desk, coffee maker, mini fridge, and sink. The decor was outdated and the room had poor lighting. Location wise it is near a highway so a bit noisy and pretty close to a fire station as I heard many sirens late at night. It is an $80 cab ride from LAX and about $40 cab ride to downtown LA. It is really close to Universal Studios, about a $6 cab ride. Walking there though is quite a hike as it is all uphill, the walk back, not as bad. There is no shuttle from the hotel. As well there are no cabs that wait there, you have to call to get a cab. If you are planning to visit Universal Studios I believe this would be the best rate for hotel you will get nearby. There is a Hilton and a Sheraton right near the park but you are looking at about double the price. Everything about the stay was average, nothing great, nothing terrible. I don't think I would return though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripster3554
Reviews.Content: Nothing like this holiday inn express. very nice staff and nice clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't end up staying here and it was still a nighmare”
Reviews.Author: aussiechickie
Reviews.Content: I have a Gold level membership with the Holiday Inn Priority Club. I say this only to get across how often and frequently I stay with Holiday Inn. Before a recent trip to LA I looked at staying at HIE Los Angeles. I called and discussed a reservation with the agent. I was ready to book, their reservation system was down. She said she would called me back and did so an hour later. By this point though I had found a cheaper, nice and better located hotel in Beverly Hill (thrilled!) and told her to please cancel my reservation. More forward a month and I get my credit card bill to find out that my LA weekend had two hotel charges. One was from HIE for a no show. I call to discuss this issue. The agent saw clearly that the reservation was cancelled the same day and couldn't understand why the system still assigned a room etc. I was told that the charges would be reversed but to be patient since it can take up to 10 days. 3+ weeks later, nothing. A second call was made, this time the agent said that there was no details of a charge being made to my credit card and would send problem to hotel manager. I asked to have a call back the next day. 4 days come and pass, nothing. I call a 3rd time, she didn't even try this time, said that she would pass message on but can I please call back in the morning. 2 months, $200 out of pocket for a reservation that was never confirmed - still no resolution. Don't waste your time here. Their reservation being down was a lucky thing. A few more minutes serving found me a hotel next to the Beverly Center, across the street from Magnolia Bakery and many other delicious eateries. We walked up and down all weekend enjoying the shops and food - for cheaper than an HIE room.

Reviews.Title: “We won't ever try them again..”
Reviews.Author: BimBam976
Reviews.Content: Made reservations a month in advance. One non-smoking room. The day of check-in, I knew we'd be late, so called hotel and told them we were coming and would be late. They had already charged my credit card 3 weeks prior. We got there at 10pm, and only had smoking rooms remaining. Our room still had their little blue 'ozonator' machine (they had forgotten to remove it) to try and clean the stench--it was not working. They had us check another room--reeked just as bad. When asked why they hadn't gone completely smoke-free like all the other large chains, the poor guy at the counter didn't know (Ju was his name); he was following orders from the (nonpresent) manager/owners. At $175/night, I expected better... We crashed at the nearby Sheraton after getting a full-refund for our 3 reserved nights. Then paid LESS money and stepped up in quality by staying at the Orlando on 3rd and Orlando on the other side of the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: GRFamily
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 10pm and were greeted as Priority Club Gold Members. We received an upgrade from a standard hotel room to a junior suite and an offer of a late checkout (2pm) if needed. The room was clean; the only thing missing was the bottled water, which we did receive on subsequent days. The room was clean and quiet, the breakfast was great and the breakfast area was clean every day. We took the bus to the Hollywood Bowl (which picked us up right in front and dropped us off across the street) and drove to Universal Studios (a mile at the most). All said, a great hotel at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal Studios and Hollywood Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: Macxine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally close to Universal Studios and just few miles away from Hollywood Blvd and Griffith Conservatory. The hotel room is clean, very nice and friendly staff and a good variety of breakfast, and complimentary bottled of water and some candies from the manager. The other plus for us was they allowed us to check-in 2 hours before the check-in time! The downside was they do not have a shuttle which was stated on their website, also the wifi was not working, our room phone doesn't have a dial tone and the hotel's cable was so slow! They better change their cable/Internet/phone provider. Nevertheless, we had a pleasant stay and might come back only if they fix the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lots of Attractions near!!! Very Good Price for value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Saxyblus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, was close to Universal and had great staff when you could find them lol! Would recommend to anyone traveling on a family vacation or trip to the area as they did a good job overall! It was filled with kids when we were there so noise was an issue, but it was not the hotels fault or lack of trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: dragoms
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights while on spring break with my 17 yr old son. This hotel is very conveniently located next to 101. It is easy on/off the freeway as well as a quick trip to either Universal or Burbank. Griffith Observatory is about 15 minutes away. Free parking for the Metro (subway) is located near Universal and is a great way to go downtown or other locations around town istead of driving. Free Hotel parking is tight but always available. The breakfast was adequate and always well stocked but we got tired of the same eggs, sausage gravy, and dry biscuits. I think the pancake maker was broken while we were there. They did provide bagels, packaged donuts, 4 types of cereal, yogurt and plenty of fruit everyday. The pool is located next to the parking garage (very wierd) and we didn't use it. The pool is very small. We did see some kids enjoying it though. They told us the water was very warm. To use the elevator you must swipe your key card. This is a great extra level of security in the hotel. The laundry facility was sufficient and it was 75 cents each to wash and dry in big machines. I had to by detergent at the front desk. The front desk was always helpful and friendly. My request for a room on a high floor away from the elevators was accomodated. We were on the mountain side of the building (not the freeway side). Our room was extremely clean. The beds were impeccably made every day. Our pillows were labeled "soft" and "firm" so we could choose what we wanted. Towels were replaced daily and we always had extra. They were a bit skimpy though. The bathroom was just about as clean as I have ever seen in a hotel (rivaling 5* hotels). To me this is extremely imporant for any room of any price. I was very impressed with the maids at this hotel. They were friendly and worked very hard. I am unsure why someone else said they heard a neighbor sneeze because they walls appeared extremely thick between the rooms. The hotel was sold out the entire time we were there (Easter week). We didn't hear sneezing, coughing, talking, tv's, doors slamming, etc EVER. One reason you don't hear doors slamming is that the doors stop just shy of shutting, requiring you do push them shut. A wonderful inconvenience that added to the silence in this hotel. It was hard to believe all the rooms were occupied because at times the hotel was so quiet. Another person commented on the window used for after hours check-in. They did lock the lobby after about 9 pm and used the window in the parking garage. I saw this a smart not an indication of the unsafety of the local area. While we didn't walk anywhere it seemed the surrounding area was very safe. Our room was $115 which is very good for LA and this hotel is right in the middle of town. We did Getty Center, Pasadena, Hollywood, Burbank and Six Flags. This hotel was right in the middle of all these locations. I don't think you could do wrong staying here but you might want 2 rooms for a family of 4 or 5.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near many tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: evabree
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights as it was near Universal Studio and many other nearby attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A great and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mazimaz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 3 night at thw HI Cahuenga. We arrived with a car and we had a parking place right near the entrance. The clerck was very nice and we recieved our rook keys on the spot. The fist thing that I noticed when stepping in the hotel was the smell. It smelled so so clean! And our room was no different. The only thing that botherd me was that the walls were realty thin and i could hear the guy nezt to us sneezing :) Other then that the HI has FREE transportaion to the sites andback (we didn;t move our car once) and they have a complimentry breakfast that was superb. Would totaly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “good for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: salona16
Reviews.Content: i stayed here till i moved into my new house. wasa good hotel. very good staff. decent room service and food. nice gym and pool. very close to unievrsal city with a free shuttle service. nice place for tourists. very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Hollywood Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Backstreets_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a couple of blocks from the 101 ramp. Its within 3 miles of Hollywood Blvd, Griffith Observatory, Warner Brothers Studios, and Mulholland Drive. Its walking distance to Universal Studios. There's a good vegetarian restaurant on the block and a Starbucks across the street. The hotel has free parking, clean rooms, comfy beds, free wifi, an accessible PC with printer, a good hot breakfast, and the public areas look fairly new. I'd definitely stay here again and I highly recommend walking the easy trails in the nearby Runyon Canyon for spectacular views of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location for Universal and Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Shine-n-Shady
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel very very close to Universal and Hollywood area. Clean and reasonably priced with a good amount of (free) car parking, and a pretty decent breakfast. Little extra things like the free wifi are really nice for us overseas travellers so we can more easily keep in touch with home. Staff service was happy and of a good standard, happy to recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “My grubbiest experience of the Holiday Inn Franchise”
Reviews.Author: scoops50
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, adequate parking. The hotel had a distinctly "Grimy" feel to it. Everthing was at it's most basic. I've stayed at Holiday Inn Exoress, Travelodges and Premier Travel Inn's - this was the lowest experince. It was OK - but the lowest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed, nice big room.”
Reviews.Author: seaweedsprites
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a free upgrade to a king suite, having only booked a standard king. This room was huge and featured a nice comfy bed and enormous HD TV. The only snag was that we were looking right out onto the bust street and could hear the traffic a little at night. The location of the hotel is great, allowing quick access to Warner Brothers and Universal which are just 5 mins away in the car. Hollywood blvd. is a 5 minute walk away. Breakfast was good with a selection including fruit, the 2 computer business center was popular as it was free. Easy to find, good location, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Older motel, updated for a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ofamof
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express is an older facility, but has been updated to be generally very good and comfortable. Room was large, clean, and comfortable, as was the bathroom. My room was very quiet - though I was on the backside of the motel rather than facing busy Cahuenga. The only downsides are really that some of the common areas are not so great, and the neighborhood is not very inviting (though safe seeming). The lobby and breakfast are were okay, though they did smell slightly stale and mildewy. The free parking was adequate while I was there, though it might be tight if the motel was fuller. Very close to Universal Studios (walkable for most), but there are very few dining options without driving. Overall fine - though it did seem a but expensive for what it is. Oh - and forget about the pool is that's important to you - tiny (I actually thought it was a whirlpool), and it's in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price paid”
Reviews.Author: JLC1957
Reviews.Content: The hotel was 'tired' but in a great location for Universal Studios and just off the main road into Hollywood. Could walk to Universal but along main roads. Good parking and really friendly and obliging staff. Good breakfast choice and lots to go at, which was regularly refreshed. Small indoor pool. Laundry room with 1 washer and 1 dryer so had to pick time to use it.

Reviews.Title: “average and hard bed”
Reviews.Author: Travelicious55
Reviews.Content: Was looking to find a hotel around Burbank under $150 a night, which is hard to find. This place had a very good location. Otherwise, service very average. Asked for a quiet room away from elevator/stairs. After packing suitcases up all the way to 3rd floor only to find out we were directly beside the elevator. Had to go all the way back to lobby to ask for another room, then had to wait for 15 min while she finished with another customer. Room itself was ok, but for $140 not impressive thats for sure. Hairs in shower & on toilet, not the best cleaning job. Bed hard as a rock, felt like it and had a sore back when we woke up the next day. Whatever, could not find anything better for the price in the area. Was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: CanadiensFan1971
Reviews.Content: I whole-heartedly agree with previous three reviewers. Good free breakfast (hot and cold items to choose from), convenient free parking, free internet in lobby and in room, clean pool. Also, comfy bed, linens, pillows, plush towels, cute terrace, clean, spacious room with most of the amenities you would want. Super friendly and helpful staff (they went the extra mile compared to most hotels we have stayed). I think the management does a great job finding these folks. Don't let the somewhat dated exterior put you of, inside is nicely renovated. We walked to Universal Studios (10 min) and spent two days there. Also ate at a nearby pub (Henry's Hat) about a 5 min walk and had two memorable and well-priced meals there. Their drinks are incredible. Beware of the nearby convenience store down the road, it will try to rip you off if you look like a tourist (the woman tried to charge my Hubby $11.99 for a soda when she saw that he was from Canada...). Just off the freeway, so if you come by car, it's handy. We stayed there before and after a cruise from Long Beach and the best way to and from (also to and from LAX) is to reserve Super Shuttle. We paid $35 to LAX vs $90 by cab.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: averyfamily3
Reviews.Content: Not only was this hotel clean and comfortable and the people who worked there were more than helpful! If you are planning a trip to Universal Studios you MUST stay here, it is a few blocks away from Universal Studios. Right off the freeway. The breakfast was great fresh baked cinamon rolls, omletes, sausage gravy and biscuits and many other choices. The room was very clean and we were given extra towels at check in. The indoor pool was clean and heated. Will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Universal Studios visit”
Reviews.Author: OandRee
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Universal Studios, stay here. The hotel was very well equipped with nice room and bed, good breakfast (although not enough space in the dining room) and a 5 minute walk to Universal Studios. The hotel also had free wireless internet access. We arrived early and were checked into a room before 11am and when I asked if we could leave the car there for a few extra hours the following day after check out, were told that was no problem. For around Â£80 booked via their own website, this was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Universal Studios - book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Larse_Andersen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights 4 persons in one room for $317 tax included, free and fast internet on the rooms and from a pc in the lobby, free parking, free breakfast, free print of our tickets to Universal studios and boarding pass. The location is great if you are going to Universal Studios â€“ 10 minutes walk. The rooms are clean, just big enough, nothing fancy, but delivered all we needed for the stay. The free PC in the lobby with the printer is a great service â€“ which saved us several ours standing in line. When I went down to use it â€“ one of the employees was using it â€“ but she immediately offered it to me â€“ even before I asked!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: car0lparnham
Reviews.Content: don't let the dated exterior put you off this hotel! the interior is what you would expect from holiday inn.All the usual ammenities, clean and comfortable polite,helpful staff,the location is excellent for Hollywood,we went on a mini bus tour of the hills and star homes with LA tours $36 each well worth the money. The driver was hillarious with star tales and his personal observations. We didn't see anyone known but nobody seemed to care. Hollywood itself was dirty and a bit dodgy, oh well been there, done that, won't bother again.Heavy police presance may give you a clue. Universal Studios is 1/2 mile from hotel just over the highway. $67 each,again worth the money, great day out for anyone. definately need a car to get around though.Go early to Universal as it gets very busy as you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ma3usnavy
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel. I took a quick weekend trip to LA with a friend and was looking for an affordable hotel near WeHo that wasn't too scary. This hotel was about 10 mins from WeHo and I felt very comfortable there. My room faced the freeway, but it was sufficiently soundproofed. My ONLY gripe was that there didn't seem to be enough parking for the size of the hotel (although it was free, which sets it apart from other hotels in the area.) I had to do some "creative" parking when I got back late. The service more than made up for that though... as a member of their frequent guest program, they gave me a complimentary basket with some water, a granola bar, and some mini candy bars, as well as a late check out. Their room rate was very good compared to other comparable hotels in the area, especially when you factor in the free parking. If you're going to the WeHo area, I'd definately recommend checking out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than any 5star hotel I've stayed.”
Reviews.Author: LondonEmma_86
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel based on location and worldmate's reviews. it was very pleasant. They gave my husband a complimentary shaving stuff and loads of other goodies cause they heard we're looking for a pharmacy. Even the internet was free! First night we stayed at first floor in Portola building. It was very noisy cause it was right next to the parking lot - loads of drunken people at that night. The Next morning we drove all the way to Las Vegas and stayed in MGM Grand hotel, which is 5 star hotel (I guess all of them are in Vegas?). Service was well.. not so good. I mean, what service? People were rude and unhelpful... I didn't see any cleaners and our trash was full for the next 2 days. Yeah, there was all the luxury from jacuzzi to nice restaurants and starbucks around the corner but still it couldn't beat Holiday Inn. When we came back from Vegas we stayed another 2 nights in Holiday Inn and requested a different room from different building. We got it and slept well. In the morning I bought tickets to the universal studios from the hotels gift shop (they had this promotion how you can use the same ticket for 2 days and they also have transportation between hotel and universal) and ate breakfast at coffee house(?). Service was outstanding and I'll definitely stay at holiday inn if I ever get a chance to go LA again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Coffeetwin
Reviews.Content: We had checked out from Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco in the morning, fly to LA, and check-in to Holiday Inn Universal City in the afternoon, and were pleased to see the continuity of great service of the holiday inn hotel chains. Receptionist was very friendly, room is clean, pillows come in options of soft and firm, clean towel and bedsheet. Parking was free, complimentary BF, although not a wide spread, but was good enough for us. Internet is free. There's an indoor swimming pool too.... but thoughout our 3 days stay, we did not see anybody using the pool... There are pizza and sandwich shop across the hotel. Universal Studio is only about 5-10 mins drive. You can actually walk there if u dun mind. It's also not too far from the Walk of fame, maybe about 10-15mins drive... so this is really a good location if you're concentrating your LA visit to Hollywood and Universal studio. Entrance and exit of the freeway is right outside the hotel, so it's really convenient if you're drinving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: boogerlayne
Reviews.Content: I must say that this hotel exceeded any expectations that I had before I left. The hotel was close to Universal Studios, so close in fact that you could walk if you don't mind a little stroll down the street. I was able to get it for $139 for a Saturday night which is more than half the price of the 2 hotels closer to the park. My cab rides were $5 each way with 4 adults in the cab. The gentleman that checked us in was quite pleasant and accomodating with whatever request we had. The room was on the average side but was clean, clean,clean. I will definately stay here again the next time I take in a show at the Gibson Amphitheatre. Great job to the managment as well as the staff. I travel alot and have to admit that this team has it figured out.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoTravel_8
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is conveniently located within minutes of Hollywood by car. It is within walking distance to Universal. It is within a 30 minute drive of some great beaches. The rooms were clean. The hotel staff was extremely helpful in answering all our questions. We would definetly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: agentmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn for one night while visiting Hollywood. It was a very pleasant stay. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful with any questions we had regarding the area and directions. The room was average size and the beds were very comfortable. The linens and towels were very nice and I really liked the shower head. The continental breakfast was very good. The location was very close to Univeral Studios and the City Walk and not to far from Hollywood Boulevard. You could get picked up by tour buses to see various Hollywood sites if wanted. I wish we would have stayed longer at this hotel but we had reservations in orange county at a beach resort. It was an excellent choice for seeing Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cocomilwaukee
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I were in L. A. for 24 hours at the end of a soccer tourny in San Diego. We hit Universal Studios, made the last tram tour, came out exhausted, dirty and with no place to stay at 9:00 pm. We checked our GPS and the first on the list was this place. We called, got the last room, and directions-- practically across the street. ( The satelite had not yet located us/it) The man at the desk was so helpful. We got a clean, fresh room at a great rate for LA. The desk clerk helped us the next morning with directions to tourist spots- Graumans Chinese theatre, where all the tours can be had. We had a memorable stay with much thanks to Holiday Inn Express. My daughter is telling all her friends back home here in Wisconsin how fantstic LA is. I think she's ready to move there!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but nice for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Athens85
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Holiday Inn Express Cahuenga pass. The hotel is located 5 minutes by car to the Universal Studios and that's was the reason beacuse we choose it. Room are good, we hade room with wiev on the back side of the hotel: the view was not good but it was very quite. What you get for what you pay is good, even breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Maid stole our bag!”
Reviews.Author: tenchimiyuki
Reviews.Content: We were there during the Memorial Weekend. We stayed at the suite, which is pretty good with one room with a king-size bed and another room with two-queen beds. The rooms were fairly clean and comfortable. However, as we were getting ready to check out, we realized that a bag that we have brought up to the room when we first checked in, was no longer there. In the bag were unopened snacks. I know those things are not expensive, but the thought of the maid taking things from the customers just left me disappointed in Holiday Inn Express. We later came to the conclusion that the maid might have opened our unlocked suitcase. Our suitcase's zipper was closed when we left the room, but when we returned later that night, the zipper was opened. I reported in to the front desk, but the lady just gave me a form to fill. She says they will look into it, but I think it is just a bunch of B/S. I also sent an email to Ben (the manager there), but haven't heard back from him yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location”
Reviews.Author: ttoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two separate times during the last week of March as we had flights in and out of Burbank airport. This hotel is very convienent to the airport (5 miles away) and also many local sights we were visiting (hollywood area, universal and warner brother studios, hollywood bowl, la brea tar pits). Breakfast and free parking a plus. Bathroom could have been cleaned a bit better on our first visit but rest of the place was good. Both visits manager left basket of goodies (cookies, candy, and water bottles) and these were greatly appreciated after long travels and lots of LA traffic jams!!!!! We faced freeway both times but didn't find traffic noise intrusive. Pool is very small but not the reason we were there. Visited the Hilton property down the street that our friends were staying at which was very fancy/nice with attractive pool scene but considering the mandatory parking and no breakfast provided- the Holiday Inn Express is a much better value if you are site seeing and not planning alot of time to hang out around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: JCole07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice find. The rooms were clean and roomy and the breakfast in the morning was chock full of variety. We were very weary travellers when we came upon this hotel, and knowing the Holiday Inn Express name we thought we couldnt go wrong. The staff were very nice as well. Priced at $140/night in LA we didnt think was too bad. And if travellers are hitting Universal Studios on their LA tour, well, the park is just down the street, so it was a bonus for us who were visiting US the following day. Very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofmeadows
Reviews.Content: I was happy with this hotel. My teenage daughter and I stayed for 4 days while in LA. Clean room, felt safe, friendly staff. Our room was next to a family with small children and we could hear them crying and banging things around, but it was not enough to discourage me from staying here again. Close to Universal Studios, with very easy access to the 101 and local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: travlin'momma
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, close to universal, not a far drive from Hollywood Blvd, right at a freeway exit/entrance. Starbucks is right across street, 2 fast food places down street but nothing else good is close at least that I saw. The breakfast was horrible, the room was not vacuumed well, and there were ants in the bathroom. I paid over $200 a night for a suite and did not feel it was worth that much money. I read the other posts about the window break in. I asked the desk about it and she said it never happened. My window was on the ground floor in the back facing the alley but there is a fence around the back. It looks like a good fence but like anything- if someone wanted to scale it they could- but the fence made me feel better. Though honestly I felt insecure here. I felt like at any time someone could just walk in off the street or in from the window. As we were leaving we noticed that one of our windows was broken and did not close and lock.. I probably would not stay here again. Though the free parking was great and the location was close to sightseeing. I think tours pickup here too.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: lakemissy
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation six weeks in advance, requesting the quietest room possible. We were given a room in the front of the hotel, facing a frontage road, next to a major freeway. The traffic noise didn't stop all night. Plus, the room was next to the elevator and the vending machines. This is a quiet room?! At checkout, another guest was complaining because the toilet in their room didn't work, and they had to go to the lobby to use the restroom. They had complained, someone "fixed" it, and it didn't work all night. Plus, there was a boom box blasting in the room next to them which they complained about, and management did nothing to help them. Don't even consider staying at this place. Drive right by.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant (not great) stay”
Reviews.Author: travelinm0m
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for two nights during our trip to Universal Studios. Location wasn't too bad , we walked to Universal the first day. A little bit of a hike going to Universal, not as bad coming back to the hotel. The room itself was clean but I thought it would be bigger since it was called a "Junior Suite". It did come with a sink, good sized fridge and microwave. The pool, though heated, was a little disappointing. Very small, I think one of the smallest pools I have ever seen. We almost thought it was a hot tub. The breakfast was fine, it actually filled us up until lunch time at the park. Overall not a great hotel but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good, stay”
Reviews.Author: ristacat
Reviews.Content: My husband and two teenagers, recently stayed on our trip to Universal Studios. It was very accessible to this attraction, I would recommend the location. The pool, is very small like everyone says but it is still functional, as we took a dip. We stayed on the third floor. The room is nice and spacious, very nice bathroom. They had several pillow choices (soft, firm). The mattress wasn't particularly comfortable. The breakfast area was small and the selection wasn't great but we were able to eat. They did have cinnamon rolls. It's a strange location right off of the highway. You go into a garage and the lobby is underground in the garage area. Nothing spectacular, but nothing to complain about either. We had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMom-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed the very same weekend of the robbery mentioned by another guest. That is so unfortunate. We stayed on the second floor facing the back. I specifically requested this location ahead of time because of the comments that I had seen on this site regarding the noise coming from the adjacent freeway. I'm extremely picky when it comes to a hotel's cleanliness, and I must say that I could find nothing to complain about. The room was impeccably clean, the sheets, bedding etc were divine and pretty new. The continental breakfast was enough to start your day. I did have very noisy neighbors next door who seemed to be trying to talk over their loud TV. After 12:30 am, we called the front desk and he said he would take care of it. They quieted down shortly after. The location is very convenient to all Hollywood sights. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: 3vacationer3
Reviews.Content: Warning!!! We were robbed during the night while sleeping, they entered through a closed window, which later we discovered had no lock on it. the report is on file with LAPD. Others were reporting robberies when we went down to report ours. We had our children with us.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Wobblyboot
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel I was expecting it to be noisy being so close toa highway however I was surprised. I booked the hotel due to its proximity to Universal Studios and I was plesantly surprised. The rooms were clean and large enough for a family of four and was quiet. The breakfast was the Holiday Inn breakfast that was expected and ample for the family. Great location if you plan a trip to Universal and Waner Brothers studios

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: be32
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. Once on business in Hollywood and once for pleasure visiting Universal Studios. The people are very nice, the facility is clean, and it is convenient to the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: kiki77
Reviews.Content: We arrived round midnight. Great room. If I really have to search about negative things: the view was a wall and the swimming pool was very small, but since we did'nt really go for the view, nor for the swimming pool, we did'nt bother. All the rest was super: the rooms were always very clean, there was enough choice at breakfast, the staff was friendly... I'll definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: GaÃºcho
Reviews.Content: I don't expected too much, but the room was clean, spacious, comfortable, realy close to the Univeral City and no so far from the Hollywood Boulevard and Sunset - and the parking is free!! The breakfest is ok. For the price, is difficult to be better!

Reviews.Title: “Still convenient and value for money”
Reviews.Author: donsyb
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel in 6 months, we chose it due to it's location near Universal Studios (5 minutes away), free parking and free breakfast. This time we had a room at the back of the hotel which was much quieter than our previous stay which was overlooking the freeway. For just over $100 we've yet to find better value on this side of town

Reviews.Title: “good idea to use the security lock”
Reviews.Author: drbutchie
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Problems started at check in. Was given a key card for my assigned room on the third floor. Went up there and the key didn't work. Went back to the desk and they reprogrammed the key and assured me it would work. It didn't, and the person already in the room fortunately had the inside security lock on (that's why the key wouldn't work!!) heard me and asked what I was doing. Went back to the lobby and after some time they assigned me a room on the second floor...no outside window..but a large window to the indoor hallway?! The room was clean but very noisy. the heating system was very loud and if anyone upstairs flushed a toilet I'm sure the drains were run thru this room. In the am the houskeeping staff was very inconsiderate shouting and laughing from one end of the hall to the other so don't plan to sleep after 8am even if you want to. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: suebee724
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation here for my 2 night stay in CA to attend a friend's wedding. As a 20-something single female traveler, I wanted a place that would be safe, cheap/reasonably priced, and close to the wedding location, and this place fit all the criteria. Well, I would've liked the price to have been lower than the $118/night rate I got, but I think I would've had to forego one of my requirements I arrived on a Friday morning and asked the person managing the front desk if it would be possible to check in early. He was very polite and friendly and found a room that would be ready for me within 15 - 20 minutes. Breakfast was already supposed to have been over, but everything was still laid out, so he suggested I have breakfast while I waited. The food was still pretty fresh and a lot better than what I had expected for a Holiday Inn Express. My room was clean and up-to-date. The bathroom was OK. The only complaints I have are that the hair dryer had some yellowish stains that would not come off. There was also a hair in the sink, and the inside of the shower curtain had a few brown and yellow stains on it. The cleaning staff was very friendly and courteous. As a caution to light sleepers, they did make a lot of noise in the morning as they cleaned. Parking is limited, but even with full occupancy, I managed to find a spot by the curb. I never felt unsafe my entire stay there. I came back fairly late both nights, and I never saw or heard anything or anyone unusual as I made my way back to my room. Check out was easy since I had registered as a Priority Club member when I booked my reservation. Overall, I had a great experience with this Holiday Inn Express location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, P:leasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: VegasBling
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the hotel for a show at the Gibson Theater at Universal City Walk at Universal Studios. Other than staying at the very pricey hotels adjacent to Universal, staying at the Holiday Inn Express was a wonderful choice. I was concerned about the negative remarks on this website, but found that the hotel was much better than I thought it would be. The hotel is conveniently located at the 101 South (Hollywood) Freeway. Across the street is a Chevron gas station. Within walking distance, there are a couple of quaint restaurants. When we checked into our room (Room #310), we found a large basket of complimentary chocolates, cookies, and 2 bottled waters. The room had a view of an alley - it wasn't offensive, but it wasn't the best, either. However, I would take the alley over a hotel roof. The room itself was immaculate. There were two Queen beds along with a desk, executive chair, lounge chair, and bench. We had ordered a rollaway bed ($15 extra cost) but it would have been too crowded to have the rollaway in the room. The room also had three phones in the room (one on the nightstand, one on the desk, and one in the bathroom). The bathroom is spacious and clean. The tub is one of the cleanest I have ever seen, and I have stayed at many hotels. It has a very nice Kohler shower head, and the curtain is on a rod that is curved for more bathing space. The towels are of high quality,. The room and hallway was quiet even though the hotel was full. With regard to the "bleach smell" - I would say the smell is more like a cleaner smell with a floral scent. It is not offensive and is actually pleasant because you know the hotel and room is clean. The carpet was in excellent condition - very clean with no tears and no worn spots. The ice machines are modern and dispense ice quickly. Hotel is well maintained. The hotel room card must be used in order to access the elevator. The breakfast is nice and is served from 6:30 a.m. to 9:30 a.m. We did not experience any crowds at all - there were only 2 or 3 at any given time. There is a nice selection of bagels, cinnamon rolls, crossaints, hard boiled eggs, dry cereals (several choices), oatmeal, muffins, donuts, and a variety of juices and water along with hot tea and coffee. Universal Studios is 1.5 miles away. It is challenging to exit the hotel because there is a three way signal light at the hotel. The signal is confusing. You cannot walk to Universal, but the hotel is one of the closest other than the very pricey ones adjacent to Universal Studios. Internet access is free, however, guests must obtain a cable from the front desk. You must connect the cable to your laptop at the desk, so it is not so convenient, as you must be at the desk to do work rather than any other part of the room. Lastly, the parking is limited. Guests must place a paper placard in the window to show they are guests at the room. In addition, latecomers end up parking next to the office rather than in a spot. Otherwise, I feel the room and the hotel was a good deal (I booked two months in advance) and was well worth what we paid. I would stay there again and recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice service, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: TP_Travel_Chronicles
Reviews.Content: The location for this holiday inn express is what you pay for. The hotel was full when we checked in. The parking space is a little tight, but the hotel staff helps you park. The staff was courteous, and the breakfast in the morning was decent and contained bagels, cereals but no toast. We had booked a smoking room by mistake, and as the hotel was full, the front desk couldn't help us. As expected, the room smelled of strong smoke. They had a basket of goodies (chocolates, cookies) + 2 bottles of water, which was nice. We would stay here again, but would certainly search for a better price

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us from Alberta Canada arrived late on January 10. Our reserved room was ready and the night manager gave us his parking space because the underground lot was full - a nice touch. We booked here because it is close to Universal Studios Hollywood and easy to access from LAX. The room was fine, everything worked and no troubles. Breakfast standard HIE fare, not much room for seating. As reported by other travellers, an awful smell in the elevator. Take the stairs - some exercise and the smell was much less. Thankfully the room didn't have the smell! 15 minute walk to Universal Studios where we spent the day. That evening the manager was helpful in suggesting a place to eat down Cahuenga Blvd. We caught BF the next day and then left. Would recommend for those going to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Jeaniblog
Reviews.Content: Five of us arrived 30th Dec 2005. 2 Bedded Suite on second floor with view of brick wall. Probably preferably to front rooms on main road. Nothing special. Horrid smell of ?perming lotion on landing. Breakfast average, not enough seating. No BBC America on TV. Comfy beds. A/C very cold and noisy, had to switch off at night. Nice bathrooms, extractor inadequate. Small indoor pool. Pricey at $199 per night excluding tax. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: DaveHodgins
Reviews.Content: Was a little dubious about this choice having read some previous reviews however the hotel turned out to be immaculately clean, provided pleasant rooms and a highly satisfactory complimentary breakfast. The staff could not have been more pleasant. The local area was questioned by some previous reviewers however I did not feel at all threatened and enjoyed a high quality meal locally at the California Canteen and even enjoyed a beer at a bar just across from the hotel. My only reason for not rating the hotel as excellent is the less than adequate pool - not much bigger than a bath really however that said the hotel is excellent value for money. Previous reviewers have said that you can walk to Univeral Studios. You can but would probaly need a shower on arrival after the uphill trek - get a cab stay on for a meal at Citywalk & have a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: cpatraveler
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is well worth it. It is very close to the studios, Hollywood Bowl and Hollywood. The room wasn't anything special, but it was very clean. I would recommend that you get a room not facing the road. They first assigned us a room facing the road and we heard a lot of road noise. When we requested a room on the other side, they did so with no problem and we didn't hear a thing. For some reason there was a peculiar smell right when you entered the lobby. No problem in our room. Breakfast was a not much to speak of, but it got us going in the morning. Staff was very friendly and overall we would return if we are in the area again.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Los Angeles - Universal City - Cahuenga
HotelInfo.Address: 3241 Cahuenga Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90068
